column4: ok, now when i run dkpg --configre -a i am getting a ton of out of space errors still, but i see they are all having to do with mkinitramfs
Are there old kernels under /boot ?
yes, lots
Might want to get rid of those (normally via apt, but if you can't then just rm them for now)
what in here can is afely remove? http://paste.ubuntu.com/842009/
Anything that doesn't relate to your current kernel
Well, don't touch the grub directory though
still can't run dpkg --configure -a, i am thinking this is a mkinitramfs issue?
Might be. Can you pastebin the errors?
my damn terminal isn't letting me scroll up... how would i output the messages to a file? > doesn't seem to work
Uh, if > doesn't work I think something's extremely wrong with your shell...
trying a restart..
i can't seem to send my output to a file, i only ever get one line in the file. using: "dpkg --configure -a > /home/raevol/Desktop/err.txt"
Well, that's not supposed to happen, but if your drive is full it might
thunar is now reporting that i have 548 megs of free space on my /
Hm, well, /home is on a separate partition, is it not?
yes
Err, actually...\
That ain't gonna work -- the command (dpkg one) needs sudo
sudo dpkg --configure -a | tee $HOME/Desktop/err.txt
sorry, i was using sudo, just forgot to type it in here
with the "tee" in there it gave me no file
